intro: Edraianthus tenuifolius subsp. caricinus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved edraianthus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers in early summer. It is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Primulaceae family.
